intro: Aristotelia fruticosa var. rigidula, commonly known as the New Zealand kōwhai, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is adapted to coastal environments and thrives in well-drained soils. It is a member of the Elaeocarpaceae family and is known for its resilience to harsh coastal conditions. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds.
